intro: Uvaria ngounyensis, commonly known as the Ngounyé uvaria, is a tropical shrub native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Uvaria ngounyensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of African flora.
